messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the cpython program, here is the asan report

The sanitizer detected a heap use after free vulnerability. The explanation of the vulnerability is: Memory is accessed after it has been freed, leading to undefined behavior and security risks. Here is the detail: 

READ of size 8 at 0x50700014e068 thread T0
    - Py_TYPE Include/object.h:333:16
    - long_richcompare Objects/longobject.c:3265:5
    - do_richcompare Objects/object.c:922:15
    - PyObject_RichCompare Objects/object.c:965:21
    - PyObject_RichCompareBool Objects/object.c:987:11
    - deque_index_impl Modules/_collectionsmodule.c:1222:15
    - deque_index Modules/clinic/_collectionsmodule.c.h:248:20
    - method_vectorcall_FASTCALL Objects/descrobject.c:401:24
    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:168:11
    - PyObject_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:327:12
    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:815:23
    - _PyEval_EvalFrame Include/internal/pycore_ceval.h:115:16
    - _PyEval_Vector Python/ceval.c:1788:12
    - PyEval_EvalCode Python/ceval.c:592:21
    - run_eval_code_obj Python/pythonrun.c:1294:9

    - _PyRun_SimpleFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:464:13
    - _PyRun_AnyFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:77:15
    - pymain_run_file_obj Modules/main.c:357:15

    - pymain_main Modules/main.c:737:12
    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:761:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12

0x50700014e068 is located 56 bytes inside of 72-byte region [0x50700014e030,0x50700014e078)
freed by thread T0 here:
    - _PyMem_RawFree Objects/obmalloc.c:84:5
    - _PyMem_DebugRawFree Objects/obmalloc.c:2398:5

    - _PyFunction_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:413:16

previously allocated by thread T0 here:

    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:761:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12


To fix this issue, follow the advice below:

1. Set pointers to NULL immediately after freeing them to prevent accidental reuse.
2. Ensure that each allocated memory block is freed only once.
3. Track memory allocations and deallocations systematically to prevent use-after-free conditions.
4. Consider swap the order of freeing memory and accessing it.

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 111 to line 150 in Modules/_collectionsmodule.c:
111|  * Whenever d.leftblock == d.rightblock, then:
112|  *     d.leftindex + d.len - 1 == d.rightindex
113|  *
114|  * However, when d.leftblock != d.rightblock, the d.leftindex and
115|  * d.rightindex become indices into distinct blocks and either may
116|  * be larger than the other.
117|  *
118|  * Empty deques have:
119|  *     d.len == 0
120|  *     d.leftblock == d.rightblock
121|  *     d.leftindex == CENTER + 1
122|  *     d.rightindex == CENTER
123|  *
124|  * Checking for d.len == 0 is the intended way to see whether d is empty.
125|  */
126| 
127| typedef struct BLOCK {
128|     struct BLOCK *leftlink;
129|     PyObject *data[BLOCKLEN];
130|     struct BLOCK *rightlink;
131| } block;
132| 
133| struct dequeobject {
134|     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
135|     block *leftblock;
136|     block *rightblock;
137|     Py_ssize_t leftindex;       /* 0 <= leftindex < BLOCKLEN */
138|     Py_ssize_t rightindex;      /* 0 <= rightindex < BLOCKLEN */
139|     size_t state;               /* incremented whenever the indices move */
140|     Py_ssize_t maxlen;          /* maxlen is -1 for unbounded deques */
141|     Py_ssize_t numfreeblocks;
142|     block *freeblocks[MAXFREEBLOCKS];
143|     PyObject *weakreflist;
144| };
145| 
146| /* For debug builds, add error checking to track the endpoints
147|  * in the chain of links.  The goal is to make sure that link
148|  * assignments only take place at endpoints so that links already
149|  * in use do not get overwritten.
150|  *
